intro: Labatia ciliolata, commonly known as the silky labatia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
